title: totalvi
description: Performs mapping to the reference by totalvi model: https://docs.scvi-tools.org/en/stable/tutorials/notebooks/scarches_scvi_tools.html#Reference-mapping-with-TOTALVI

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required. Input h5mu file with query data to integrate with reference
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required. Input h5mu file with query data to integrate with reference.

reference.description: Type: `file`, required. Input h5mu file with reference data to train the TOTALVI model
reference.help_text: Type: `file`, required. Input h5mu file with reference data to train the TOTALVI model.

force_retrain.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If true, retrain the model and save it to reference_model_path
force_retrain.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If true, retrain the model and save it to reference_model_path

query_proteins_modality.description: Type: `string`. Name of the modality in the input (query) h5mu file containing protein data
query_proteins_modality.help_text: Type: `string`. Name of the modality in the input (query) h5mu file containing protein data

reference_proteins_modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `prot`. Name of the modality containing proteins in the reference
reference_proteins_modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `prot`. Name of the modality containing proteins in the reference

input_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. Input layer to use. If None, X is used

obs_batch.description: Type: `string`, default: `sample_id`. Column name discriminating between your batches
obs_batch.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `sample_id`. Column name discriminating between your batches.

var_input.help_text: Type: `string`. .var column containing highly variable genes. By default, do not subset genes.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`. Output h5mu file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`. Output h5mu file.

obsm_output.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_integrated_totalvi`. In which .obsm slot to store the resulting integrated embedding.

obsm_normalized_rna_output.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_totalvi_normalized_rna`. In which .obsm slot to store the normalized RNA from TOTALVI.

obsm_normalized_protein_output.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_totalvi_normalized_protein`. In which .obsm slot to store the normalized protein data from TOTALVI.

reference_model_path.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.reference_model_path.reference_model_path`. Directory with the reference model
reference_model_path.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.reference_model_path.reference_model_path`. Directory with the reference model. If not exists, trained model will be saved there

query_model_path.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.query_model_path.query_model_path`. Directory, where the query model will be saved
query_model_path.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.query_model_path.query_model_path`. Directory, where the query model will be saved

max_epochs.description: Type: `integer`, default: `400`. Number of passes through the dataset
max_epochs.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `400`. Number of passes through the dataset

max_query_epochs.description: Type: `integer`, default: `200`. Number of passes through the dataset, when fine-tuning model for query
max_query_epochs.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `200`. Number of passes through the dataset, when fine-tuning model for query

weight_decay.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. Weight decay, when fine-tuning model for query
weight_decay.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. Weight decay, when fine-tuning model for query

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
